comments.creator: josh@joshmatthews.net
comments.raw_text: With gDumpEventList turned on, if I alt-tab back to Fennec then the parent process aborts inside nsDisplayRemoteShadow::GetPerFrameKey, which is apparently never supposed to be called. See stack trace for more details.
comments.author: josh@joshmatthews.net
comments.text:
Created attachment 545758
Stack trace

With gDumpEventList turned on, if I alt-tab back to Fennec then the parent process aborts inside nsDisplayRemoteShadow::GetPerFrameKey, which is apparently never supposed to be called. See stack trace for more details.

comments.creator: ben@stechz.com
comments.text:
Yes. Timothy had me add an abort if we ever access the per-frame key (because the displayport remote display item should not have a frame).

This isn't normally a problem unless you are debugging Fennec, in which case I comment it out. :) We could just remove it altogether.
comments.author: ben@stechz.com
